title: Only Integers or variables implemented so far for `len` expressions
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/603

General question: when I use a feature that LFortran says is not implemented, is it still helpful for me to raise an issue with an example?

`$ cat plus.f90`
```
module m
implicit none
contains
elemental function plus(c1,c2) result(c12)
! trim two strings and add them
character (len=*),   intent(in) :: c1,c2
character (len=len_trim(c1)+len_trim(c2)) :: c12
c12 = trim(c1) // trim(c2)
end function plus
end module m

program main
use m, only: plus
implicit none  
write (*,"(a)") plus("ab ","cd  ")
end program main
```
`$ gfortran plus.f90 && ./a.out`
`abcd`

`$ lfortran plus.f90`
```
semantic error: Only Integers or variables implemented so far for `len` expressions
 --> plus.f90:7:1
  |
7 | character (len=len_trim(c1)+len_trim(c2)) :: c12
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```
